name: Arkhe - Pneuma & Ousia
desc: A useful Fontainian mechanism for both exploration and combat that uses two opposing forces: Pneuma and Ousia

customize.text: Arkhe is one of the main energy sources used in <color=#ece5d8>Fontaine</color> . Fontainian vision holders inherit either <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> or <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> alignment as a special attribute while <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> Traveler has <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> alignment. It consists of two opposing forces: <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> and <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color>
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color>

When <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> Aligned energy meets <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> Aligned energy, an <color=#ffffff>Annihilation reaction</color> will be triggered.
The <color=#ffffff>Annihilation reaction</color> as a special interaction is useful in both exploration and combat.
Obtaining an Arkhe alignment

There are two ways to get a <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> or <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> alignment:
Fontainian characters and <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> Traveler have an innate Arkhe alignment
The player can pick up <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> blocks while exploring <color=#ece5d8>Fontaine</color> .
Any character can pick up a <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> or <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> block and obtain the specific alignment for 60s. It will remain despite teleporting to a different location or swapping the deployed team, or until another block is picked up. Fontainian characters can use their specific attacks to immediately trigger the effect corresponding to their Arkhe with a fixed cooldown. They can also pick up either blocks regardless of their innate alignment.
Picking up a <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> energy block will give <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> alignment
Picking up an <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> energy block will give the <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> alignment
Picking up an <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> energy block while having obtained <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> alignment previously will cause <color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color>
Application
Land Exploration

<color=#ffffff>Arkhe application with characters with innate alignment</color>
Fontainian characters and <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> Traveler can apply Arkhe when they use a specific attack dependent on the specific character. It can be Normal Attack (Ex:

customize.name: Furina
customize.desc: The absolute focus of the stage of judgment, until the final applause sounds.

customize.name: Clorinde
customize.desc: An undefeated Champion Duelist. Sword in hand, she defends justice in the Court of Fontaine.

customize.text: ), Elemental Skill (Ex:

customize.name: Traveler (Hydro)
customize.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

customize.name: Lynette
customize.desc: A magic assistant of few words, her emotions are as inscrutable as any cat's.

customize.text: ), Ultimate Skill (Ex:

customize.name: Wriothesley
customize.desc: Duke of the Fortress of Meropide, Lord Incognito of the murky depths.

customize.text:
)
When used according to the specifications, Arkhe is applied in a follow up attack that can deal Elemental DMG without Elemental application. <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> aligned characters release " <color=#ffffff>Spiritbreath Thorns</color> " while <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> aligned characters release " <color=#ffffff>Surging Blades</color> ". They have a separate cooldown and do not require a target to be unleashed.

<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> - <color=#ffffff>Spiritbreath Thorns</color>
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> - <color=#ffffff>Surging Blades</color>

<color=#ffe14b>Spiritbreath Thorn</color> and <color=#37ffff>Surging Blade</color> deal AoE damage, so they can trigger many <color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reactions at once.
<color=#ffffff>Arkhe application using</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>blocks</color>
When a character picks up a <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> block, the next Normal / Charged / Plunging Attack that hits an Arkhe aligned object or any enemy will apply the stored energy without dealing additional DMG. Bow users can use an Aimed shot to apply the Arkhe.

<color=#ffffff>Using</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>energy on a</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff>aligned enemy</color>
<color=#ffffff>Using</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>energy on a</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff>aligned object</color>
Underwater Exploration

<color=#ffffff>Arkhe application with characters with innate alignment</color>
When underwater, Normal Attacks are replaced with <color=#ffd780>Transoceanic Sourcewater</color> attacks, which can be used to release Arkhe energy. If the character has an innate Arkhe alignment, the <color=#ffd780>Transoceanic Sourcewater</color> will shine differently depending on the Arkhe alignment.
<color=#ffffff>Appearance of</color> <color=#ffd780>Transoceanic Sourcewater</color> <color=#ffffff>with a</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff>aligned character</color>
<color=#ffffff>Appearance of</color> <color=#ffd780>Transoceanic Sourcewater</color> <color=#ffffff>with an</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>aligned character</color>
<color=#ffffff>Arkhe application using</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>blocks</color>
Characters with innate Arkhe alignment can trigger energies without the use of <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> Blocks.

If a character with an innate Arkhe alignment picks up a <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> block getting the opposite Arkhe, the next attack will apply <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> and <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> at the same time.
Characters
The Arkhe alignments of characters can be confirmed by several methods: the design of their vision, character preview page and Combat Talent page.

<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff>aligned</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>Vision bearer</color>
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>aligned</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>Vision bearer</color>
Characters with Arkhe alignment

<color=#ffffff>Character</color>
<color=#ffffff>Arkhe alignment and Talent</color>

customize.text:
<color=#ffffff>Alignment:</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color>

customize.name: Lyney
customize.desc: A famed Fontainian magician who possesses great stage presence as well as gift of the gab. Audiences are enthralled by his exquisite skills, and they hang on to his every clever word.

<color=#ffffff>Talent:</color> The Prop Arrow causes a Spiritbreath Thorn to descend upon its hit location dealing <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> -aligned <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> DMG (CD: 6s).

customize.name: Freminet
customize.desc: A reserved young man who is well-versed in diving. Beneath his distant, icy demeanor lies a pure heart bereft of all flaws.

customize.text:
<color=#ffffff>Alignment:</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color>

customize.name: Neuvillette
customize.desc: The Chief Justice of Fontaine, known as the Iudex, is renowned for his unassailable impartiality.

customize.text:
<color=#ffffff>Alignment:</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color>

customize.name: Navia

customize.desc: The captain of the Special Security and Surveillance Patrol, who wears justice as an ever-present seal upon her heart. Her musket shall only ever point at the guilty.

<color=#ffffff>Alignment:</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color>
<color=#ffffff>Version Released:</color> <color=#ffffff73>4.7</color>
<color=#ffffff>Type:</color> <color=#ffffff73>Normal Attack after Elemental Skill</color>
<color=#ffffff>Talent:</color> When Clorinde's Swift Hunt shots strike, a Surging Blade will be called forth that deals <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> -aligned <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> DMG (CD: 10s).

customize.name: Sigewinne
customize.desc: A Melusine and the Fortress of Meropide's head nurse. She cares equally for every convict locked in the undersea prison.

customize.text:
<color=#ffffff>Alignment:</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color>
<color=#ffffff>Version Released:</color> <color=#ffffff73>4.7</color>

<color=#ffffff>Talent:</color> Upon using Sigewinne's Blostering Bubblebalms, a Surging Blade will be called forth that deals <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> -aligned <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> DMG (CD: 10s).

customize.name: Emilie
customize.desc: A Fontainian perfumer, one who bottles secrets.

<color=#ffffff>Alignment:</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color>
<color=#ffffff>Version Released:</color> <color=#ffffff73>4.8</color>
<color=#ffffff>Type:</color> <color=#ffffff73>Elemental Skill</color>
<color=#ffffff>Talent:</color> After Emilie creates a Lumidouce Case using Fragrance Extraction, a Spiritbreath Thorn will descend in front of her and pierce her opponent, dealing <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> -aligned <color=#99ff88>Dendro DMG</color> (CD: 10s).

customize.name: Escoffier
customize.desc: The ex-head chef of Hotel Debord, renowned throughout Fontaine as the Patissiere Supreme and vanguard of precision gastronomy. Has incomparably strict standards when it comes to cooking.

<color=#ffffff>Alignment:</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color>
<color=#ffffff>Version Released:</color> <color=#ffffff73>5.6</color>
<color=#ffffff>Type:</color> <color=#ffffff73>Elemental Skill</color>
<color=#ffffff>Talent:</color> After Escoffier activates her Cooking Mek in Cold Storage mode, a Surging Blade will be summoned, dealing <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> -aligned <color=#99ffff>Cryo DMG</color> (CD: 10s).
Weapons
When a character with innate Arkhe alignment is equipped with a <color=#ece5d8>Fontaine</color> weapon, the weapon will emit a glow according to the character's specific Arkhe alignment.
Weapons providing Arkhe alignment
<color=#ffffff>Sword of Narzissenkreuz</color>

customize.name: Sword of Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc: A sword whose power faded when the story ended. It will now embark upon a new journey with the power that remains within it, which commemorates a certain great dream.

customize.text: The weapon can be obtained by completing

When the equipping character does not have an Arkhe: When Normal Attacks, Charged Attacks, or Plunging Attacks strike, a <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> or <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> energy blast will be unleashed, dealing <color=#37ffff>160%/200%/240%/280%/320%</color> of ATK as DMG. This effect can be triggered once every 12s. The energy blast type is determined by the current type of the Sword of Narzissenkreuz.
Enemies
Boss Enemy

<color=#ffffff>Enemy</color>
<color=#ffffff>Description</color>
<color=#ffffff>Icewind Suite - Dirge of Coppelia</color>

customize.name: Icewind Suite
customize.desc:
Artificed Dancers developed by the Fontaine Research Institute.

Bossuet originally intended for Artificed Dancers to be works of art that transcended the era of mechanical reproduction. But after Bossuet was forced to resign, the project was taken over by Maillardet, who had his own unique understanding of what he wanted to achieve. As a result, while their features were perfected during the course of its development, the Artificed Dancers gradually strayed from Bossuet's original vision.

customize.text:
During Climax, Coppelia becomes <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> <color=#ffffff73>-</color> aligned, increasing the RES to all DMG by 25% during all <color=#ffffff>3</color> sequences of attacks while uninterrupted.
Attacking with a <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> -aligned attack removes the RES increase and Her wind pulses's AoE and DMG will decrease (to 60%).
<color=#ffffff>3</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> -aligned hits during a single Climax will interrupt it and stun the enemy for a short period of time.
<color=#ffffff>Icewind Suite - Nemesis of Coppelius</color>

customize.name: Icewind Suite
customize.desc:
Artificed Dancers developed by the Fontaine Research Institute.

Bossuet originally intended for Artificed Dancers to be works of art that transcended the era of mechanical reproduction. But after Bossuet was forced to resign, the project was taken over by Maillardet, who had his own unique understanding of what he wanted to achieve. As a result, while their features were perfected during the course of its development, the Artificed Dancers gradually strayed from Bossuet's original vision.

customize.text:
During Climax, Coppelius receives a <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> -aligned <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> shield.
Attacking with an <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> -aligned attack will immediately break the shield.
<color=#ffffff>3</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> -aligned hits during a single Climax will interrupt it and stun the enemy for a short period of time.
<color=#ffffff>Experimental Field Generator</color>

customize.name: Experimental Field Generator
customize.desc:
A large device designed by the late Edwin Eastinghouse. It has the ability to "counteract" the effects of gravity. According to the original design intentions, this was the first step in a plan to turn Fontaine into a city in the sky, so never again would the people have to worry about the waves that once swept over the land. Even if all seven nations were to be swallowed by the deeps, the elegant Court of Fontaine would float above it all, just like Celestia. Even the secrets of the universe would no longer seem so distant.

The Arkhium in the device's core has the characteristics of "splitting" or "precipitation," and can take matter, or certain things outside of matter, and separate them. It is said that this process can be reversed, but the Fontaine Research Institute is infatuated only with the physical effects it can produce.

customize.text:
When the enemy teleports to the center of the arena and decreases the strength of gravity, it becomes <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> -aligned and creates shockwaves that deals <color=#ffe699>Geo</color> DMG.
<color=#ffffff>3</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> -aligned hits will interrupt it and the gravity will be restored.
<color=#ffffff>All-Devouring Narwhal</color>

customize.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
customize.desc:
A mysterious and gargantuan creature from another world.

Poets often liken the starry sky to the ocean. They've seen or dreamt of countless bioluminescent plankton floating on a moonless sea, resembling a galaxy, or the moonlight ripped apart by waves on the sea's surface, like shimmering stars. In the most fantastical stories or outrageous lies, the stars found in the depths of the cosmos might be teeming with life, much like Teyvat, and the universe itself is akin to an ocean. Realistically speaking, however, if a profound universe full of life exists, why hasn't any of that life made contact with Teyvat?

Maybe the universe has been constantly trying to infiltrate Teyvat, or maybe a higher power created borders to protect this world.

customize.text:
While facing the enemy, it summons the Eye of the Maelstrom to deal AoE <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> DMG.
If the Eye of the Maelstrom is hit by by an Arkhe attack ( <color=#ffffff>8</color> non-Arkhe attacks), it will be destroyed and the Fury gauge will increase by a quarter.
While facing the black shadow, an Eye of the Maelstrom will be charging up to deal <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> , <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> or <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> DMG. If it gets hit by an Arkhe attack, it will be destroyed and the shadow will lose 25% of its Max HP.
Normal and Elite Enemies

<color=#ffffff>Enemy</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>Abyss Enemies</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Enemies shares the same mechanism and 1 Arkhe (</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> or <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> <color=#ffffff73>) attack can instantly destroy and paralyze the enemy for a long period of time.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Large Shatterstone Breacher Primus & Shatterstone Breacher Primus</color>

customize.name: Large Shatterstone Breacher Primus
customize.desc:
A strange life form that mostly appears in Elynas.

Melusines perceive Breacher Primuses as harmless creatures, and many even find them completely adorable.

The visual perception of Melusines is very different from humans.

customize.name: Shatterstone Breacher Primus
customize.desc:
A strange life form that mostly appears in Elynas.

Receives a powerful shock from encountering ousia or pneuma energy, and thus Breacher Primuses can be driven away using this relatively nonaggressive and noninvasive means.

customize.text: When the enemy enters a stressed state periodically, it will gain a <color=#ffe699>Geo</color> shield.
<color=#ffffff>Large Overgrown Breacher Primus & Overgrown Breacher Primus</color>

customize.name: Large Overgrown Breacher Primus
customize.desc:
A strange life form that mostly appears in Elynas.

The nature of a Breacher Primus defies known categories: they are not animals, plants, Shroom-Kin, nor Elementals. The debate among scholars of Sumeru never formally reached a consensus on just what it is, until it was finally banned as a research topic. The reason is that based on the current system of knowledge, this problem is like "the definitions prescribed by language and the true nature of things," and it is impossible to have a meaningful, final answer.

customize.name: Overgrown Breacher Primus
customize.desc:
A strange life form that mostly appears in Elynas.

In Fontaine, the earliest recorded observations of a Breacher Primus appeared shortly after the cataclysm. Records from the time show instances of Breacher Primuses both attacking and protecting humans.

customize.text: When the enemy enters a stressed state periodically, it will gain a <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> shield.

<color=#ffffff>Automaton Enemies</color>
Enemies can be either <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> or <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> and their alignments are distinguishable with attack patterns or its color.
After a certain number of <color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reactions triggered on a specific enemy, it will lose its Arkhe alignment.
<color=#ffffff>Recon Log Mek</color>

customize.name: Recon Log Mek
customize.desc:
One of the earliest new-type clockwork meka to be made.

It is said that during his time at the Institute of Natural Philosophy, the Lord-Artificer Guillotin created machines that could simulate genuine intelligence.

Though he never openly admitted it, this rumor nonetheless spurred on subsequent generations of ambitious engineers. Decades ago, one of them announced that they had created a machine that not only possessed basic thinking abilities but could also read human emotions, but in the end the results went unacknowledged.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Fires an AoE <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> bomb with delay
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Fires an AoE <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> trap
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reactions needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Unable to use elemental attacks for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Geological Survey Mek</color>

customize.name: Geological Survey Mek
customize.desc:
A clockwork meka designed for surveying underground resources and certain minerals.

Due to the fact that the desired metal type can be set, this device has proven very popular among Treasure Hoarders and Adventurers alike.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Fires <color=#ffffff>3</color> consecutive <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> projectiles
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Releases <color=#ffffff>3</color> consecutive AoE <color=#ffe699>Geo</color> shockwaves
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reactions needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Unable to use elemental attacks for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Nimble Harvester Mek</color>

customize.name: Nimble Harvester Mek
customize.desc:
A clockwork meka designed to dig up and transport soil.

Due to the inherent ability of the local water and soil to store and transmit ousia and pneuma, clockwork meka powered by the annihilation of these energies are highly favored in Fontaine. This also explains why adventurers may come across Ousia and Pneuma Blocks from time to time.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Charges at the player with <color=#80ffd7>Anemo</color> infusion
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Launches <color=#ffe699>Geo</color> dirt at the player
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Unable to use elemental attacks for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Area Alert Mek</color>

customize.name: Area Alert Mek
customize.desc:
A mechanism that is able to fire out the energy produced by an annihilation reaction. Strictly speaking, it was originally a test device that emerged from research undertaken by the Institute of Natural Philosophy before the Fontaine Research Institute had been established.

As such, despite its considerable commercial success as a sentinel and defensive device, most engineers do not consider it to be a true clockwork meka.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Fires a <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> bubble
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Fires <color=#ffffff>3</color> consecutive <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> projectiles
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Unable to attack for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Arithmetic Enhancer Mek</color>

customize.name: Arithmetic Enhancer Mek
customize.desc:
A clockwork meka designed to transmit and enhance signals.

The power that drives this clockwork meka is generated from a controlled annihilation reaction between ousia and pneuma in the kinetic core. As a result, overloading it with excessive energy will cause its original equilibrium to be disrupted.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>and</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> has the same attack patterns. The Arkhe alignment can only be distinguishable by its color.
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Stunned for a short period of time and recovers Arkhe faster than other Clockwork Mekas
<color=#ffffff>Suppression Specialist Mek</color>

customize.name: Suppression Specialist Mek
customize.desc:
A clockwork meka adapted from the Cal. Scherbius type. Unfortunately, aside from its ability to attack, it has no other capabilities.

Clockwork meka based on annihilation energy normally produce their energy by utilizing Repeaters composed of special crystals to refine ousia and pneuma from Fontaine's environment. But outside of Fontaine, they can use pre-prepared Energy Blocks to move over short distances for short periods of time. The difference can be observed from the shape of the crystal components on the meka.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Uses <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> attacks
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Uses <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> attacks
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>2</color>
Result: Unable to use elemental attacks for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Assault Specialist Mek</color>

customize.name: Assault Specialist Mek
customize.desc:
Alongside the Recon Log Mek, this was one of the first new-type clockwork meka to be made (though of course, after hundreds of years, no one refers to them as "new-type" anymore – this was simply to differentiate them from traditional clockwork mechanisms that were powered by potential energy.)

It was named to commemorate a friend of its inventor, and was originally designed to help people. However, its ability to attack people – thereby avoiding the need to put friendly personnel at risk – subsequently came to be seen as its real strength.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Uses <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> attacks
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Uses <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> attacks
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>2</color>
Result: Unable to use elemental attacks for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation Specialist Mek</color>

customize.name: Annihilation Specialist Mek
customize.desc:
Although the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering is the main organization involved in clockwork meka research and design, there are also many independent engineers and workshops that are not affiliated with the Research Institute.

The first ever machine of this type was designed by an independent engineer to commemorate their lover and sponsor. In the end, it was acquired by the Maison Gardiennage as a tool to uphold municipal security — or, as some would have it, state apparatus enforcing the monopoly on violence.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Uses <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> attacks
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Uses <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> attacks
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>2</color>
Result: Unable to use elemental attacks for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Construction Specialist Mek</color>

customize.name: Construction Specialist Mek
customize.desc:
A type of large clockwork meka which also has immeasurable value when utilized in building construction and archeological excavation. Its name comes from an engineer employed by Callas during the construction of the Clementine Line.

With Callas' financial backing, this engineer built the legendary "Golden Vessel" — a gigantic piece of construction machinery which was used to dig the Poisson Tunnel. Once the job was complete, this type of clockwork meka was designed with a similar structure but reduced to a smaller scale.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Uses <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> attacks
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Uses <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> attacks
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>2</color>
Result: Unable to use elemental attacks for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Underwater Survey Mek</color>

customize.name: Underwater Survey Mek
customize.desc:
A clockwork meka designed for underwater surveying.

In the absence of significant breakthroughs in dynamics research, kinematics research has had the most significant impact on clockwork meka design. For machines designed to perform specific tasks, biomimesis has sometimes provided the most convenient solutions.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Fires a <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> bubble
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Charges at the player
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Unable to attack for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Underwater Patrol Mek</color>

customize.name: Underwater Patrol Mek
customize.desc:
This type of clockwork meka was designed to search out, repel, and if need be exterminate aquatic life forms that pose a threat to underwater equipment.

Ever since the first diluvian period, the Fontaine Research Institute has been preoccupied with the thought that there might be a second one. Some had the idea of taking back the ruins lost to the waves and building an underwater city, whereas others looked up to the untouchable sky islands overhead with the intention of building a metropolis in the clouds.

Underwater Patrol Meks were conceived by the former, but judging from the results, it is the latter that have gained the upper hand in recent years.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Launches an <color=#80ffd7>Anemo</color> projectile
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Launches a homing <color=#bfbfbf>Physical</color> projectile
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Unable to attack for a period of time
<color=#ffffff>Deepwater Assault Mek</color>

customize.name: Deepwater Assault Mek
customize.desc:
A clockwork meka designed to conducting underwater attacks. Unlike "Underwater Patrol Mek" models, it is expected to take on much larger and fiercer opponents. Of course, the price it pays for such capabilities and its cost of manufacture is that is unable to fully unleash its capabilities against smaller opponents.

Long ago, Fontaine was once scarred by the tragic invasion of a massive monster. The revered White Armada that sailed upon the great terrestrial lake was completely destroyed in defense of the nation. The designer hoped that were such a thing to happen again, the clockwork meka would possess enough naval firepower to be the first line of defense, going before the soldiers and generals.

customize.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Launches an <color=#80ffd7>Anemo</color> projectile
<color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> : Launches 2 homing <color=#bfbfbf>Physical</color> projectiles
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction needed: <color=#ffffff>1</color>
Result: Unable to attack for a period of time

Mechanisms with Arkhe alignments can be dealt with by triggering <color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction on the puzzle using the opposite Arkhe alignment. A bow character can be helpful to apply the specific Arkhe energy from a distance.

<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Description</color>
<color=#ffffff>Pneumousia Storage Box</color>
<color=#ffffff>Showcase</color>

A super-safe storage box that absolutely cannot be opened in any way!
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Pneumousia Relay</color>
<color=#ffffff>Showcase</color>

A mysterious clockwork meka device created by the special energy system produced by <color=#ece5d8>Fontaine</color> . It possesses three energy states: <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> , Balanced, and <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> , respectively.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>The Miraculous Antoine Roger Aircraft</color>
<color=#ffffff>Showcase</color>

This is an experimental Aircraft that is propelled by energy generated from <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reactions. It will proceed along its set route upon being activated.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Fixed Storage Device and Energy Transfer Device</color>
<color=#ffffff>Showcase</color>

Storage devices can provide energy to Transfer and Research Terminals. Some devices are infused with an Arkhe alignment and requires <color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> to activate.
Tutorial:

customize.name: Fixed Storage Device and Energy Transfer Device

customize.text: <color=#ffffff>Enhanced Pneumousia Amplifier</color>

This device will grant powerful buffs to the troublesome opponents faced by adventurers or bandits.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Miscellaneous</color>
<color=#ffffff>Showcase</color>

Attacking the core of the device with the opposite Arkhe alignments will trigger <color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction which will spawn waves of enemies to defeat, after which the core will take the opposite Arkhe alignment.
The process must be repeated until the anomalies are stabilized.
The mechanism can be found both on land and underwater.
The Steambird Special Edition III: Pneuma, Ousia, and Their Mutual Annihilation

Dual Application
With the use of a <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> block,

customize.name: Lyney
customize.desc: A famed Fontainian magician who possesses great stage presence as well as gift of the gab. Audiences are enthralled by his exquisite skills, and they hang on to his every clever word.

customize.text: can to apply Arkhe twice. Through <color=#ff9999>The Prop Arrow</color> <color=#ffffff73>, he can unleash a</color> <color=#ffe14b>Spiritbreath Thorn</color> alongside another <color=#ffe14b>Spiritbreath Thorn</color> / <color=#37ffff>Surging Blade</color> depending on the alignment of the <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> block.
<color=#ffffff>Lyney with a</color> <color=#ffe14b>Pneuma</color> <color=#ffffff>block</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lyney with an</color> <color=#37ffff>Ousia</color> <color=#ffffff>block</color>
Non-Reactive Arkhe
Even though Arkhe application deals elemental damage, it does not apply said element and are thus unable to trigger Elemental Reactions.
Co-op Mode

In Co-op mode, Arkhe will act independently and consider players separately.
When collecting a <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> block, only the player who collects it will receive the alignment and thus, the Arkhe will only trigger when the player with infusion applies it.
<color=#ffffff>Annihilation</color> reaction will also not be triggered if different players collect the opposite alignments.
Arkhe Infusion

When the player picks up a <color=#ffe14b>Pneum</color> <color=#37ffff>ousia</color> block and acquire Arkhe alignment, it can last for 60s when not applied, regardless of party deployment, active character defeat, and teleportation.
The player can take advantage of it to complete the puzzles.

value.name: Pneuma, Ousia, and Their Mutual Annihilation
